org.corfudb.runtime.smr

Class LLTransaction

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.corfudb.runtime.smr.LLTransaction
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable, Comparable<IStreamEntry>, IStreamEntry, ITransaction

    public class LLTransaction
extends Object
implements ITransaction, IStreamEntry, Serializable
    New type of transaction to support the legacy SMRE. A long-lived txn (LLTransaction) executes in memory before appending an intention to the Corfu log (propose). The information stored in a LLTransaction should act like the info stored in the legacy TXInt. Created by taia on 6/12/15.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • executeTransaction

        public void executeTransaction(ISMREngine engine)
        Execute this command on a specific SMR engine. This function is called whenever a stream encounters the LLTransaction entry in a stream; namely, in the legacy code, this function should implement what would have happened when a stream encountered a TxInt.
        Specified by:
        executeTransaction in interface ITransaction
        Parameters:
        engine - The SMR engine to run this command on.

      • getTransaction

        public ITransactionCommand getTransaction()
        Returns the transaction command.
        Specified by:
        getTransaction in interface ITransaction
        Returns:
        The command(s) to be executed for this transaction.

      • propose

        public ITimestamp propose()
                   throws IOException
        Propose to the SMR engine(s) for the transaction to be executed. Apply the lambda function that is the transaction; buffer updates in BufferedSMREngines, and at the end, write a LLTransaction entry to the Corfu log; this entry should contain a legacy TxInt, as well as the buffered commands.
        Specified by:
        propose in interface ITransaction
        Returns:
        The timestamp that the transaction was proposed at. This timestamp should be a valid timestamp for all streams that the transaction belongs to, otherwise, the transaction will abort.
        Throws:
        IOException
